Line 15: Line 15:
'''Nero Burning ROM''', commonly called just '''Nero''', is an [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] by [[Nero AG]], formerly [[Ahead Software]].<ref name="theinquirer">{{cite news | url = http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx?article=37873 | title = 'Nero Lite' and 'Nero Micro': smaller sometimes is better | first = Fernando | last = Cassia | date = 2007-02-27 | publisher = [[The Inquirer]] | accessdate = 2007-03-07 }}</ref> As of version 6, the program has been a part of [[Nero (software suite)|Nero software suite]].
'''Nero Burning ROM''', commonly called just '''Nero''', is an [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] by [[Nero AG]], formerly [[Ahead Software]].<ref name="theinquirer">{{cite news | url = http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx?article=37873 | title = 'Nero Lite' and 'Nero Micro': smaller sometimes is better | first = Fernando | last = Cassia | date = 2007-02-27 | publisher = [[The Inquirer]] | accessdate = 2007-03-07 }}</ref> As of version 6, the program has been a part of [[Nero (software suite)|Nero software suite]].
â   â
'''Nero Linux''' is a more recent standalone incarnation of Nero Burning ROM that works on various distributions of [[Linux]]. Nero Linux does not work on Microsoft Windows and therefore is not included with Nero software suite.
 
'''Nero Express''', a simplified edition of Nero Burning ROM targeted for entry-level customers, is also available with Nero software suite. Although Nero Express is not as powerful as the full-featured Nero Burning ROM, it features a more streamlined user interface that appeals to most users and offers a broader range of features than those offered by Windows. Nero Express is also integrated into Nero software suite, especially into OEM editions of this software which lack Nero Burning ROM.
'''Nero Express''', a simplified edition of Nero Burning ROM targeted for entry-level customers, is also available with Nero software suite. Although Nero Express is not as powerful as the full-featured Nero Burning ROM, it features a more streamlined user interface that appeals to most users and offers a broader range of features than those offered by Windows. Nero Express is also integrated into Nero software suite, especially into OEM editions of this software which lack Nero Burning ROM.

{{Expand-section|date=March 2009}}
{{Expand-section|date=March 2009}}
  +   +
'''Nero Linux''' is a more recent standalone incarnation of Nero Burning ROM that works on various distributions of [[Linux]]. Nero Linux does not work on Microsoft Windows and therefore is not included with Nero software suite.
  +
A [[Linux]] port of Nero Burning ROM application, Nero Linux, was announced as a free "upgrade" from the [[Microsoft Windows]] version in March 2005.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.flexbeta.net/main/articles.php?action=show&showarticle=86 | title = NeroLinux vs K3b | publisher = Flexbeta | date = 2005-03-15 | accessdate = 2007-02-01 }}</ref> The application replicates most features of the Windows version, and uses the [[GTK+]] graphical toolkit. As of [[2008-02-26]] a trial version is freely downloadable.
A [[Linux]] port of Nero Burning ROM application, Nero Linux, was announced as a free "upgrade" from the [[Microsoft Windows]] version in March 2005.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.flexbeta.net/main/articles.php?action=show&showarticle=86 | title = NeroLinux vs K3b | publisher = Flexbeta | date = 2005-03-15 | accessdate = 2007-02-01 }}</ref> The application replicates most features of the Windows version, and uses the [[GTK+]] graphical toolkit. As of [[2008-02-26]] a trial version is freely downloadable.
